body.p: A condition characterized by an abnormally high number of mature WBCs is __________.

feedback.p: Incorrect. Leukopenia is an abnormally low level of WBCs.
Incorrect. Leukemia is characterized by a high number of WBC but this high number is the result of cancerous nonfunctional cells.
Correct. Leukocytosis is a condition characterized by an abnormally high number of mature WBC.
Incorrect. Neutropenia is a condition of abnormally low neutrophils.
Incorrect. Because neutrophils are produced in the bone marrow, marrow dysfunction will commonly lead to neutropenia, but it is not the only cause on this list.

Incorrect. Leukemia is an overproduction of abnormal white blood cells, which leads to a decrease in functional neutrophils, and therefore neutropenia. But this is not the only cause of neutropenia on this list.
Incorrect. Certain infections, such as the flu, may lead to temporary neutropenia, but it is not the only cause on this list.

Correct. Neutrophils are made in the bone marrow, so bone marrow dysfunction or overproduction of abnormal white blood cells (leukemia) can lead to neutropenia. Certain infections, such as the flu, can also lead to neutropenia.
